      • getAccelerometerSensorValues

        public float[] getAccelerometerSensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getAccelerometerSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        All values are in SI units (m/s^2)
        • values[0]: Acceleration minus Gx on the x-axis
        • values[1]: Acceleration minus Gy on the y-axis
        • values[2]: Acceleration minus Gz on the z-axis

      • getLightSensorValues

        public float getLightSensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getLightSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        Ambient light level in SI lux units

      • getOrientationSensorValues

        public float[] getOrientationSensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getOrientationSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        All values are angles in degrees.
        • values[0]: Azimuth, angle between the magnetic north direction and the y-axis, around the z-axis (0 to 359). 0=North, 90=East, 180=South, 270=West
        • values[1]: Pitch, rotation around x-axis (-180 to 180), with positive values when the z-axis moves toward the y-axis.
        • values[2]: Roll, rotation around the y-axis (-90 to 90) increasing as the device moves clockwise.

      • getProximitySensorValues

        public float getProximitySensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getProximitySensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        Proximity sensor distance measured in centimeters

        getPressureSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        Atmospheric pressure in hPa (millibar)

      • getGyroscopeSensorValues

        public float[] getGyroscopeSensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getGyroscopeSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        All values are in radians/second and measure the rate of rotation around the device's local X, Y and Z axis. The coordinate system is the same as is used for the acceleration sensor. Rotation is positive in the counter-clockwise direction. That is, an observer looking from some positive location on the x, y or z axis at a device positioned on the origin would report positive rotation if the device appeared to be rotating counter clockwise. Note that this is the standard mathematical definition of positive rotation and does not agree with the definition of roll given earlier.
        • values[0]: Angular speed around the x-axis
        • values[1]: Angular speed around the y-axis
        • values[2]: Angular speed around the z-axis

      • getMagneticFieldSensorValues

        public float[] getMagneticFieldSensorValues()
        Specified by:
        getMagneticFieldSensorValues in interface Sensor
        Returns:
        All values are in micro-Tesla (uT) and measure the ambient magnetic field in the X, Y and Z axis.
